CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper June 21, 1941, pg. 24, reads: "Board of Education Program in Full Swing - Hill District playgrounds of the Board of Education at in full swing and are catering to capacity mobs of youth, as the above pictures show.  The general lack of other facilities makes these recreational centers the only available place for young Hill citizens to play, other than the streets and alleys.  Above left and lower photos show activities at the Miller School Playground.  Supervisors here always have more children than they can conveniently handle... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Woman wearing floral dress observing boys playing with ball on Miller School playground surrounded by fence, Hill District
